title: Sunderland want Arsenal legend Patrick Vieira to take over from David Moyes if Scot is fired or quits
text:
EFL Boss of Goss Sunderland want Arsenal legend Patrick Vieira to take over from David Moyes if Scot is fired or quits 
Plus Jose Mourinho's hour-long instructions to Manchester United ballboys ahead of Liverpool match paid dividends Exclusive Comments SUNDERLAND chiefs have a managerial back-up plan in case David Moyes leaves. 
And Patrick Vieira tops the emergency list should results not pick up or Moyes , 53, decides to walk away. Getty Images 5 Sunderland are lining up Patrick Vieira to become their next manager 
Former Arsenal and Manchester City midfielder Vieira, 40, is coaching New York City in the MLS but has ambitions to manage in the Premier League. Keep up to date with ALL the Sunderland news, gossip, transfers and goals on our club page plus fixtures, results and live match commentary 
City see him as a future long-term boss. But there is no plan to bring him in soon — so the Black Cats may be an attractive start for him. 
SAVVY Jose Mourinho’s attention to detail really is something else. 
The Special One spent an HOUR teaching Manchester United’s Under-16s to be ‘clever’ ball boys for their Prem clash with Liverpool . 
He showed them how to react depending on the score. And his ploy worked as they got the ball back fast to help United grab a late draw. West Brom 2-0 Sunderland : Fletcher and Brunt condemn Black Cats to loss PA:Press Association Jose Mourinho gave Man Utd's ballboys a long lesson before the Liverpool game 
STEVE BRUCE’S Aston Villa must shell out for Conor Hourihane. 
The Villa boss wants Barnsley’s skipper and will pay the £30,000-a-week wages he is after. 
Tykes want about £3million for the midfielder, 25, and Bruce is also haggling over a salary for their right-back James Bree, 19. 
DERBY are ready to sell Scottish wideman Ikechi Anya, 29, or let him go out on loan. 
Rams striker Nick Blackman, 27, could move on, with Wigan keen, and County could swoop for Grimsby hotshot Omar Bogle, 24. GARY ROWETT fancies the Norwich job if the Canaries lose patience with boss Alex Neil. 
Former Birmingham chief spoke Rowett to Nottingham Forest when an American group tried to take over but pulled out when their bid failed. 
Now he is waiting on the Canaries firing Neil, if their promotion hopes fade. 
CARDIFF and boss Neil Warnock will start talks about a new long-term contract after he has lifted them out of trouble. 
Warnock’s deal ends this summer, but the Bluebirds have begun negotiations to keep the 68-year-old for another year at least. 
Meanwhile, Steve Coppell is making a comeback as a special adviser to Millwall boss Neil Harris. The ex-Palace chief has been analysing games and helping Harris. Keep up-to-date with all the latest transfer news and gossip ahead of the January window with SunSport's daily LIVE blog PA:Press Association 5 Bolton could be forced to sell their Macron stadium 
CASH-STRAPPED Bolton could sell their Macron Stadium and hotel for £15million after an approach by a British-based group. 
League One Wanderers face a battle to raise the £800,000-plus monthly payroll. 
But this would make the club very hard to sell as the overall value would go down. 
OXFORD’S Michael Appleton is being tipped to replace Lee Johnson should Bristol City axe their under-pressure boss. 
NIGEL REO-COKER, 32, wants to return to England as a free agent after his spell in the MLS with Montreal Impact. 
Malmo centre-half Kari Arnason, who helped Iceland knock England out of the Euros, is another free agent looking to return to the country after a previous stint at Rotherham. Goals of the Week : Watch the finest strikes from the Premier League Weekend Getty Images George Moncus is trapped at Barnsley 
A NEW rule has meant George Moncur is stuck at Barnsley. 
The midfielder, 23, is back from Peterborough but cannot join Sheffield United due to the two ‘emergency loan’ system being axed. 
CHESTERFIELD boss Gary Caldwell wants experienced Wigan coach Graham Barlow to be his No 2. 
OLDHAM chief John Sheridan is keen on making old pal Tommy Wright his No 2. 
The pair have been mates since their teens and Wright is available after leaving Barnsley. 
ROTHERHAM will let Kelvin Wilson leave, with the centre-half eyeing a return to the Midlands. 
BLACKBURN will block Ben Marshall leaving until they get £2million. 
The contract rebel’s old boss, Paul Lambert, has bid £1.3m to take him to Wolves. 
But Rovers owners Venky’s want more. 
BRENTFORD aim to double their offer for Wigan ace Max Power when they sell Scott Hogan to West Ham. 
The Bees had a £850,000 rejected and are now willing to offer twice that for the midfielder, 23.
